oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Phil Harris Day - Part 2 - 1951-07-28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is part 2 of a recording titled Phil Harris Day, featuring Phil Harris (host/performer), David Cobb (announcer) and Ott Devine (announcer) on July 28, 1951 located at Sulpher Dell Park in Nashville, Tenn. Second recording is an excerpt from WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1949-07-31 (unconfirmed), part 1. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Ott Devine (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer), Snooky Lanson (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performers), and Charlie Ackerson (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Phil Harris; Snooky Lanson; Dottie Dillard; Charlie Ackerson; Old Hickory Singers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified tune] [continued from part 1] -- Phil Harris talks -- Phil Harris introduces Governor Browning and Mayor Ben West -- Phil Harris talks -- That's What I Like About The South (Phil Harris) -- Phil Harris talks and pays recognition to Fred Russell, Beasley Smith, Francis Craig, Adrian McDowell, his brother Bill, and Freddie Muggs -- Closing statements (David Cobb) -- [break] -- Theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Opening statement (Ott Devine) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Everywhere You Go (Snooky Lanson) -- Louie Buck introduces Dottie Dillard -- My Silent Love (Dottie Dillard) -- Louie Buck introduces Ott Devine -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine) -- Louie Buck introduces Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra -- Bali Ha'i (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Charlie Ackerson -- Charlie Ackerson talks about his money-back-guarantee record -- I Had My Heart Set On You (Charlie Ackerson) -- Louie Buck introduces the Old Hickory Singers) -- Tuck Me To Sleep In My Old 'Tucky Home (Old Hickory Singers) -- Louie Buck and Snooky Lanson talk [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Harris, Phil, 1904-1995; Smith, Beasley; Craig, Francis, 1900-1966; Cobb, David (Announcer); Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Dillard, Dottie; Old Hickory Singers; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Ackerson, Charlie; Lanson, Snooky; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Sunday down south (Radio program);
